titleproper.value: Guide to the George Amberg and Robert Gessner Papers <num>MC.199</num>

author.value: Collection processed by David O'Neill.  Additional material added by Janet Bunde.

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2019-09-30T20:49:19</date>

unittitle.value: George Amberg and Robert Gessner Papers

abstract.value: The George Amberg and Robert Gessner Papers contain the personal and professional papers of George Amberg and Robert Gessner. The bulk of the collection was created by Gessner. The collection documents the development of universityÂ film education, the formation of The Society of Cinematologists, and Gessner's career as a screenwriter, novelist, and poet. Amberg's work at New York University (NYU), the University of Minnesota, and the Minneapolis School of Art is also documented.

p.value: Identification of item, date (if known); George Amberg and Robert Gessner Papers; MC 199; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University Libraries.
<list><item>The George Amberg and Robert Gessner Papers</item><item>"Robert Gessner, Film Professor" published in the New York Times June 17, 1968</item></list>

Two leather-bound scrapbooks containing articles, ephemera, and correspondence regarding the publication and critical reception of Robert Gessner's novels <emph render="italic">Traitor</emph> and <emph render="italic">Youth Is the Time</emph>; and one additional scrapbook compiled by Gessner on instruction at NYU.

subject.value: Motion picture plays --  History and criticism

Box 15: Subject Files (film index cards with attached newspaper clippings, 1930s-1960s)15General

This box contains an alphabetically filed collection of index cards, on which are printed newspaper clippings about feature films. The clippings provide information about the film's premise, the actors, the director, and local showing times. The films included in the box range in date from the 1930s to the 1960s.
